caption: The service is great, and the food is really good!

Great new spot in the south loop. Awesome to take people over the weekend, and it’s just as easy to pop over on a weeknight and have a few appetizers and drinks. Concise but consistent menu, quality drink options at fair prices, a lot of restaurants in the south loop feel very corporate but this one’s got it figured out
Food is delicious, love  the atmosphere , great service.
Great food, great service - we came for brunch and while the menu was fairly edited/limited, everyone loved their meal.  Will definitely be back!

Me and my wife stopped in for a bite to eat because we were in the area.  We had never been before and they were offering a limited menu due to Co-vid.  Everything we had was delicious.  My wife had the Black Cod that was light flaky and very tasty.  I had a burger that was cooked perfectly medium as I requested  and it was full of flavor.  For this to be a place we just stopped in because we walked by and was hungry has now become a southloop fav!  We will be back. Thanks Harbor!!!
The. Best. Mussels. Period.
Simply Great and nice service.
Excellent food and service!
Everything from start to finish was fantastic. My server was so nice and had a great smile.
Friendly stuff, delicious food, amazing price list. Everyone must visit this place at least once
Awesome!!

In an area with one of everything and not too much of one thing (sans sports bars), Harbor is a great addition to the South Loop, already a spot that stands out. Though seafood is prominent on the menu, they also serve pizzas that are a great spin on a Chicago favorite, most notably the fried chicken and pickle featured. It's built very well for any occasion, with a bar area, two person and group seating, and a chef's counter all available in an intimate setting. Harbor made a great first impression and we will absolutely be back.

My taste buds are still singing from our last visit! Everything from the starters to the entrees to the desserts meshed perfectly with my flavor-profile. The waiter did an excellent job. Everything I tried was bursting with flavor. Overall experience: 5 stars.

When chef Anthony Bernal opened Harbor restaurant in Chicago's South Loop a few months ago, he sought to attract new customers with a creatively designed interior and a seafood cuisine that pays homage to the Great Lakes region. Mission accomplished. Located at 1312 South Wabash Avenue, Harbor is open from 4 to 10 Sunday through Thursday and from 4 to 11 on Friday and Saturday. Sit at the raw bar, dine by the fireplace, lounge at a banquette or watch the chef prepare food while seated at the dining counter. All the while you are surrounded by an interior designed by the architect firm of Barber/Nestor partnered with Ingrassia Design and built by Level Construction.

The waitress who was preparing our food was very sweet and very helpful. This restaurant is sure to fulfill your cravings. Your hopes for their food and service will not fail. Thank you so much for a wonderful meal!

I had a date for lunch with this Italian pasta. This restaurant waters my mouth with tasty food. For my partner, I ordered a Rigatoni Sorrento and eggplant parmigiana. The food tastes fine indeed. Since we had freshly roasted pepper and mozzarella, the appetizer was also good. We love the food that comes from here.

Got take-out for pandemic dining and it was fantastic! The Wagyu beef in the poutine in particular was absolutely scrumptious, but all three of the dishes we got were top notch. We will definitely be ordering out from them again and hopefully dining there in person when it's safe to do so!
Our favorite restaurant. The food is creative and delicious, the waiter staff is attentive. A wonderful fine dining experienced!

They make their customers feel relaxed because of the ambiance of the place! I really love this restaurant because they don't only serve delicious and sumptuous meals but their customer service is one of a kind!  I am so happy with the service I had at this restaurant!

We had searched for this restaurant which has good feedbacks. My friends and I went here last weekend since we were food lovers. We tried their different dishes and desserts, and we really enjoyed it. One of the bests!

Perfect place for couples! The poolside common areas are great with chairs and umbrellas for free. Also, the servers are very professional to provide whatever you like from their cafe menu. The restaurant was also very cleaned and organized. A strong recommendation for your wonderful service! What a nice place, guys!
Great food, great staff, been coming a lot since they opened actually.. much appreciated addition to the south loop
Great atmosphere and friendly staff!
The food is unique with quirky ingredients that taste fantastic. I loved the atmosphere, the drinks, and the meals both in taste and presentation.

Overall, a decent neighborhood spot with friendly staff and a cozy environment. Nice outdoor space with a dog friendly patio which was a treat! Particularly nothing wrong with the experience or restaurant, but nothing we ordered ‘wow’ed’ us if that makes sense so I’ll say the food was mediocre. Our waitress was amazing and 10/10 on service.  $5 brunch drinks are a treat for sure and our favorite brunch item was the French toast!  If you’re in the area and looking for a laxed enjoyable evening this is your spot!
Nice ambiance. The food was delicious. Good service. I will definitely recommend it!
Beautiful restaurant, excellent food, friendly staff!
1st time there it was GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE

Love this spot in South Loop! We dined in on a weeknight, loved the food, and felt very safe with the tables adequately distanced and the floor to ceiling windows completely open.  My friend and I both got the harbor-ger which sounded good on the menu but was even more impressive when it came. The burgers were super juicy and came with a huge side of fries/salad which were both on point. We also got the peaches and cream for dessert and it was essentially a deconstructed peach cobbler with cream and a super crumbly topping--so so good.  They have patio seating that can't be reserved, so best come early if you prefer to sit outdoors! We can't wait to be back again.

After hearing so much about Harbor  my wife and I finally made it there and enjoyed the Sunday brunch.  We shared a compressed watermelon salad and shrimp with grits.  It was out of this world.  Everyone was right!   We highly recommend this place.
Great food, friendly service, nice atmosphere

I’ve walked by this place many times and always thought it looked like a great place to eat, but then I’d pull up the menu and decide it probably wasn’t for me. Boy was I wrong!  Absolutely delicious. I ordered the ocean trout and do not regret my decision in the least. It was buttery and flakey, cooked to a perfect medium rare, and the skin was remarkably crisp and crunchy. It was served with a wonderful medley of chorizo, corn, fava beans, and grapefruit. It sounds weird, but it’s really an excellent pairing!  My dining companion had the wagyu burger, which he reported was outstandingly good as well. He raved about the bun all night :)  Great wine selection too.  Oh, and the service was excellent! Very attentive, knowledgeable, and professional. They made us feel very welcome.  We will definitely be back, and you should give it a try!
One of the best burgers I've had in the sloop. Big shout out to Mady for A+ service.
Amazing views, wonderful staff/service, food was perfection! Took my great-nephew for our Wednesday night date night. So special and delicious! Will be back for sure!
With only 3 tables it took over 30 minutes to get service. Once we got service the food was cold and the gluten free advertised food contained gluten. Do no visit
Excellent place to visit! Great food and awesome hosts!
Had the chicken special for 2. My wife a a skeptic and also ghoul the entire meal was excellent!

Their BBQ meal for two was my favorite and most fresh quarantine takeout so far. I live right down the street from Harbor and wanted to give it a try and boy I'm happy I did. I checked out their menu online (very clear and organized) and called to place the order ahead. I ordered the BBQ meal for two which came with a salad (I picked with ranch), potato salad, coleslaw, green beans w/bacon, and two styles of BBQ (I got the brisket and pulled pork). I had mine special ordered because I'm not a fan of onions/shallots and they took them out as I asked. When I went in for the pick-up, food was placed 6 feet from others and the guys at the front were super nice and welcoming. The food was so fresh, super hot, and FLAVORFUL! Because I didn't have a "2nd" to share with, I ended up having a second meal for lunch the next day because there was so much food. Just as great re-heated! I can't wait to become a regular once life goes back to normal. Their bar looked awesome, too. Until then, I'm going to try all their "meals for 2" in the coming weeks! You rock, Harbor!! Glad you are in this neighborhood.
Exceptionally fresh and delicious pick-up meal for two: flank steak
Loved the mussels and a nice glass of Cabernet at the bar.  Atmosphere was perfect just what south loop needed !
Our waiter was excellent. Gave great suggestions but wasn't intrusive. I testing drinks - may need to come back to check them out!
The Cod was amazing. The pizza with chicken , pickels and dill is intriguing. Service was top notch!
Didn’t know this place existed but so happy I found it. Nice to have a affordable great steak In the area. Would recommend!

Whenever there is so much hype on a new restaurant it really gets my expectations soaring. Walking into the place, you can feel the comfort of the atmosphere and friendliness of the staff. Looking at the compact menu, so many seafood choices with lots of vegetarian and gluten free items. So far so good. The waitress was pleasant and helpful. The cocktails were interesting.  Here's the but and the reason only 4 stars and not 5.  One of the dishes we ordered as an appetizer was the pizza with clams. We thought that sounds interesting so let's try it. Imagine looking at the 12" pizza with 4 small clam shells on the pizza. What? Then we ordered a side dish of their broccoli dish that people raved about to go with our main entrees. We never got it. What happened? Who knows. I pointed out to the waitress we never received it and it was brushed off with a "sorry."  We will go back since they are "new" in the area and I want to support the local businesses. Maybe they're still working out the kinks. I do want to try some of the other dishes on the menu, especially the broccoli side dish. But do NOT order the pizza with clams. Lol.
Great food, service, and atmosphere. A restaurant I hope sticks around the South loop for a long time.

I was initially apprehensive about the menu (it seemed small and I was skeptical that a place that has as many pizza options as seafood options could do either really well). However, I was pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious and flavors were unique (had the mussels, black cod and the Gouda mac and cheese). I didn’t try a pizza but the table next to us did, and it looked wonderful!  The service was excellent (thanks Edward). I look forward to returning to try more items on the menu.

Great food! We shared three pizzas as apps and they were the highlight of the night! I am not a fan of pickles, but the chicken pickle pizza was actually quite lovely. My favorite was the New Haven. My husband and I were so full from the pizza apps that we split the burger for an entree and it was very good.

This place I highly recommend! The restaurant has a antique-y and luxurious vibe. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming. We went for Valentine’s so I don’t know if it was because of that but the food took a while to come but man it was so worth the wait (The food from Raw Bar came out quick though). Usually fine dining places give you smaller portions which you end up ordering a lot of appetizers or sides but their portions were plenty enough and the price was not bad at all for the quality and quantity of the food. I also appreciated the fact that the servers didn’t push us to order more than what we needed. They are family/kid  friendly, but they do not have a separate kid’s menu (they have mac & cheese as a side which worked perfect for our son). This place is definitely a gem to South Loop!  *This restaurant is kid-friendly.

The food takes for ever. The tables are to crammed up. If the establishment has an open kitchen...they need to be aware that it looks horrible when they fight and throw the utensils from the kitchen side to the waiters side. Our main courses took a very long time, my main course was served raw 2 times and served after our 2 other comensals finished their own  dish. The wine list is cheap wine overpriced. The ambiance is nice, the manager did apologize about the raw dish.they gave a discount  for that. I would not come back....

I went there with my spouse and her family several days ago, and will be going back today with friends.  First, the environment is beautiful. The decor and the bar, the open kitchen, the cutlery, all very nice.  Second, the waiting staff treated us like family. I am the kind of person who never knows what to order, so I really appreciate when the staff can recommend something.  Third and last, the food was outstanding. We had the NY strip, the duck ballotine, the walleye. We also tried the broccoli, the poutine, the lentil falafel and the frisee salad. Everything was cooked and seasoned to perfection. There is a special kind of pleasure you get from a meal when you know there is refinement and care into it.  I am very happy for the South Loop, this is the kind of spot it needed!

Shout Out for Harbor! We tried the new restaurant “Harbor” at 1312 S Wabash last night and loved it!  The owners did an outstanding job with the interior. It is so pretty and comfortable. It’s the cool chic-industrial style with warm tones that I love. Even the bathrooms are pretty! 😂  We had: Fried Chicken & Pickle Pizza, Black Cod w/ mushroom side, Sausage Pizza w/ Mac & Cheese side, Vodka drinks and Gin drinks. All were superb. The Mac & Cheese is made w/ smoked gouda and you can “feel” it as my friend says—It’s a must get. The fried chicken and pickle pizza (made w/ havarti cheese) is all that I had hoped for and more. ❤️ I wanted to get a pic of the Black Cod but my huds ate it SO fast I couldn’t. He said the fish was fantastic—he’s from the Pacific Northwest, so I value his judgement with fish dishes 🤗  We will definitely go back. I recommend that you try Harbor for sure.

This place is epic!! 3 of us went one including a vegan and we all loved our food!! The prices are great and the service is top notch! The restaurant is also gorgeous! I recommend the the hummus and the stuffed squash! So good! Going back again soon!
Wonderful flavors... pleasant inviting atmosphere...going back to try some else
Lively atmosphere.  Food is decent but menu is random - pizzas, oysters, duck, poutine, etc.  Price point isn't bad aside from some main dishes.
Excellent seafood! Muscles and broth some of the best I’ve ever had. Pizzas look amazing. I’m going back and back and back. Big fan
Great space and food. The mussels appetizer was so, so, so good. I’ll be going back for those specifically!
Very Friendly helpful staff and owner and the Dishes were delicious without being too much. The portions were perfect.  I recommend the trout and old fashion.  We will visit again.

Absolutely incredible atmosphere, drinks, fish, and skillet cookie. The service was very slow, but it is also the first night of restaurant week. Did I mention the skillet cookie? Best I’ve ever had. I think there was a marshmallow in there 🤩
Food, atmosphere and service are all fantastic. We had the poutine and pizza and both were phenomenal.
Superb atmosphere and service.

Thanks to our server John  , for beautiful experience, I had a great time for my birthday, food is delicious, I try  “half chicken”, “torchio & cheese “ and “mussels , highly recommend ‼️‼️‼️ I’ll definitely come back!
Jhon our server made sure we had one of the greatest diner experiences.  Food was delicious. Atmosphere is intimate.  Perfect for birthday celebration and romantic dates.
Thank you Adam for the warm hospitality. Chicken was delicious and the place is awesome. Looking forward to come back.

Tonight we had one of the best walleye.  It was perfect texture and taste. I recommend muscles as well. Make sure you ask for an extra piece of bread because the sauce is so tasty. The manager, Adam was very welcoming.  While Our server Jhon  delived the best service

Everyone was so accommodating. We were seated by the fireplace which was great at first,  due to it being freezing that night. However,  it quickly got pretty toasty, and everyone made sure to check in on us to see if we wanted to move tables. The food was amazing!!! The menu is smaller right now, but it sounds like it will continue to grow, and the oysters were coming soon- so looking forward to that! Wer will definitely be back,  and as residents of the South Loop,  we love to see and support good restaurants in the area.
The service is great, the food taste great. Everyone was very professional and courteous.

Just what south loop needed! It's a mid-century-modern-meets-cozy-library. Food was delicious and inventive. We ordered the frisee salad, new Haven pizza, cod, and birthday cake. Fish was cooked to perfection and the carrot sauce that came with the cod was tasty and spicy. Definitely recommend and happy about this addition to south loop! Ask for Terrence!

One of the hosts came by, asked how everything was and I said: “I think this might be the best steak I’ve ever had.” You ever said that? Me neither. And I bet I’m older than you. My wife got the walleye and raved. The house cocktails are all named by spirit. I got the “bourbon”.  Basically a Manhattan with all their home-made ingredients, and the only one on tap. There’s a keg or something behind the bar somewhere with the cocktail and toasted oak chips inside (I asked). Delicious. Among appetizers, we got mussels. There were 6 of us, and after one taste I asked the waiter for another order. The beers are cold and fresh and local. Plus amazing wines. We can’t wait to go again. Pizza next time.
Fantastic

Just had a wonderful dinner and enjoyed every dish. Mussels are out of this world.  Chicken and pickle pizza sounds crazy but was wonderful.  Great cocktail list and the owners stopped by to say hello. All very nice people. Must visit.
Amazing !!!!!!!........ overall!!!!!
Delicious ! Beautiful ! A new gem for the city!

This is by far the best restaurant in the South Loop.  The cassoulet and mussels had heightened flavor profiles but the broccoli was such an amazing fresh, spicy surprise.  My dining partner swore the steak was the best she had ever had.  She shared a bite and I agree!  Overall, amazing flavors , beautiful atmosphere and excellent service.  You should definitely go to Harbor!
The best restaurant to have a dinner with friends, very good food, very good drinks! I highly recommend this place!
